content:
with proper syntax:
bash# Test mem/get with proper URL encoding
curl -I "https://api.nsgia.com/mem/get?id=1369de11-d01f-4cb5-9b37-87d26ef0677b&key=public-read-2025"

# Test api endpoint (should work without auth initially)
curl -I "https://api.nsgia.com/api/"

# Check if the services are running
sudo systemctl status memory-search-api
ps aux | grep memory_app
Let's also test the working endpoint to see the content:
bash# Test the working mem/search endpoint
curl -s "https://api.nsgia.com/mem/search?keyword=memory&limit=1&key=public-read-2025" | head -10
üéØ Current Working Status
‚úÖ WORKING (Ready for ChatGPT):

MariaDB Search: https://api.nsgia.com/mem/search?keyword=memory&limit=5&key=public-read-2025
Static Files: https://api.nsgia.com/memory (requires salt: 8*Fold*Path)

üîß NEEDS DEBUG:

MariaDB Get: Authentication issue
Dynamic API: Service status issue

The core functionality is working - ChatGPT can already access the search and static endpoints! Let's debug the other two endpoints to complete the system.
What do the service status checks show?RetryMH# Test mem/get with proper URL encoding
curl -I "https://api.nsgia.com/mem/get?id=1369de11-d01f-4cb5-9b37-87d26ef0677b&key=public-read-2025"
# Test api endpoint (should work without auth initially)
curl -I "https://api.nsgia.com/api/"
# Check if the services are running
sudo systemctl status memory-search-api
ps aux | grep memory_app
